HOLY RA GUYS
I just want to note something, I got my PHY Ultra Trunks the lvl 5 DOUBLE ATTACK skill and...
IT STACKS. It sounds kinda obvious, but the second attack has a high chance of being a SA, and it already happened 3 times during my fight against Merged Zamasu
So you use Trunks SA, and he immediatly does another one. So you could possibly get up to 6 bonuses, if the double-attack happened every turn.
At the very least, that skill makes Trunks possibly dish out a lot of damage on one turn, the same would go for Ultimate Gohan.
I think it's relevant to say this since he is PHY, both of them have double-attack as the "free" level 5 skill. Most people won't have dupes so this is an advantage he has over other characters.

It was brilliant, in a Hitler kind of way, it is inspiring for people who are feeling down and looking for something to get pumped up.
It's hard for some to appreciate it now because you already know how it ended, but his ideas are actually shared by a LOT of young guys, I know it reached me.
Of course, he was an idiot, if you investigate him you know he was socially retarded, but you can identify with the sentiment.
It is about isolation despite your best efforts, and stuck up girls who just won't give you a chance. That's very common even if it sounds cringy. There needs to be some kind of retribution, but he went a little too far with it, that's all.
He created a masterpiece and then betrayed it, because he didn't even kill those stuck-up bitches he hated so much or the jocks, he was aimlessly firing and killed people who had nothing to do with it.
It was a bad execution, but you can separate his deeds from the manuscript and just appreciate the text.
It's so motivating reading about his pain, you just know those are sincere feelings from the bottom of his heart. It just echoes into a lot of us, those were some fine views he had. Except that he was more about getting laid than actually getting a girlfriend, but I can overlook that and imagine he wanted a gf.

It was brilliant, in a Hitler kind of way, it was inspiring.
It's hard for some to appreciate it now because you already know how it ended, but his ideas are actually shared by a LOT of young guys, I know it reached me.
Of course, he was an idiot, if you investigate him you know he was socially retarded, but you can identify with the sentiment.
It is about isolation despite your best efforts, and stuck up girls who just won't give you a chance. That's very common even if it sounds cringy. There needs to be some kind of retribution, but he went a little too far with it, that's all.

WRITING.TITLE: Eis Shenron may be top tier right now
WRITING.TEXT:
If my analysis is correct, Eis should be a mono-int (maybe villain) staple and extremely overpowered for a free unit.
You can farm his dupes, so he's able to learn any skill, not a problem. His passive is to reduce -20% attack EACH TIME HE ATTACKS, NOT JUST ON SUPER.
You could easily max his double-attack skill and he'd be almost consistently reducing 40% attack to a target, as long as his passive works twice the same turn.
I don't know how high the chance is, but I remember someone saying that with a level 5 dodge his Buuhan was dodging pretty often.
To it, of course, you can add that Eis would be getting +3000 in every stat, so that leaves him at Janemba tier with farmable super.
This is too good in theory, only problem is getting all them orbs.
It means normal

Still, considering you can't farn those orbs, it would be a waste to spend them on SRs.
That would have been a noob trap, probably.

A better comparison would be the God leaders.
When they came out, Bandai started creating Dokkan fests assuming that you had at least 70% ATK/DEF/HP and 3 ki.
You could stomp previous content so it got harder.
Now Bandai may assume that your characters have +5000 stats, attack multiple times per turn, are super effective vs anyone and can dodge.
And things will get ugly if they assume that
